ratings.comment: Martin was a great Prof. He was a little bit dry at times but I mean it's an insurance class so what did you expect? Overall, he tried to make the content interesting and applicable. His pop quizzes are easy as long as you listen in class (they are open book). Also his midterm and final were pretty good as long as you studied. Don't buy the tophat.

I was dreading summer classes. 150 minute lectures 4 days a week. But suprisingly, with martin halek, it wasnt that bad. He kept the class interesting, and I was rarely bored. The tests are fair, and the project he assigned was not too bad. He made Insurrance fun and inresting, and I would reccomend anybody interested take his class.

Insurance material can obviously be pretty dry at times, but it is what it is. Dry sense of humor that he occasionally injects into lectures to keep you awake at least. Very knowledgeable and helpful when you ask a question in class. Quizzes are graded pretty harshly and the exams aren't fun either. Group project is a breeze. OK class/prof overall.
Lectures are incredibly boring and often cover pointless material or basics that were learned years ago. He has a sense of humor but overall the class is terrible.

His lecture is very boring. It was easy to fall asleep in his class. the quiz is mandatory and hard without the table. the exam is usually hard. If you want to survive, make sure you go to all his lecture. He is a good guy though. Just his lecture method is bad.

I am convinced that Mr. Halek believes he is one of the top Professors at UW.  Yet, amazingly, his lectures are simply a combination of material learned in other entry level classes and basic common sense concepts.  I  believe this entire class could be taught in a single 2 hour lecture.  So, take this course if you want to learn next to nothing.

His lectures are very dry. It's so easy to fall asleep during class. But the materials presented during lectures are so important for you to do well on the exams. Don't even bother buying the textbook; it's completely useless. Go to the discussions even if you think they're useless because they'll help you do well on the exams.

Overall decent. Although for an introduction class, I felt he moved through easy material painstakingly slow at points. Liked when he tied principles to real world examples. However, sometimes I got the feeling of aloofness from him.

Martin is a great teacher, although his humor might be a bit dry for most people.  The discussion section is worth it, but the book is not.  Just use the copy in the Business School Library and save your money.  Exams are easy, but this leads to a fairly steep curve.  An AB is easy, but expect to work very hard for an A.

Great professor, extremely knowledgable and interesting. Lectures are funny and worth your while. Don't buy the textbook; take good notes instead. Take the discussion section option to boost your grade, the project and quizzes will help you on the exams

I become very interested in insurance industry after taking this class. He goes over each lecture with great care and explanations. I took discussion as a part of the grade and it actually helped me a lot clarifying all ambiguities I had in lectures. Exams were a bit tough but overall it was very enjoyable.

This professor is overall a very interesting lecturer. He is very knowledgable and sometimes at times even humorous. Has a very unique system for discussion where you can choose if you want a discussion grade or not. I would recommend taking the discussion as it is an easy A for 15% of your grade. Tests aren't that easy, but the curve is helpful.
